name: SSH Connector Template
description: SSH Conector for executig non-interactive commands on remote server

icon.contents: data:image/svg+xml;charset=utf-8,%0A%3Csvg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' xmlns:xlink='http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink' width='18' height='18' viewBox='0 0 18 18'%3E%3Cimage xlink:href='data:image/png;base64,' x='0' y='0' height='100%25' width='100%25'/%3E%3C/svg%3E

properties.label: host
properties.description: Hostname/computer name or IP address of remote server host.

properties.label: port
properties.description: Port number for host server. e.g. 22

properties.label: password
properties.description: Password for username e.g. secrets.TOKEN, Secrets can be used to reference encrypted authentication credentials in Connectors. See the Secrets documentation for more details.

properties.label: Known Hosts Path
properties.description: Enter known_hosts file address present in C:\user\.ssh\known_hosts. If known_hosts file does not exists generate it. Refer Documentation for more details

properties.label: commands
properties.description: Enter commands which is going to executed on remote server.for e.g ["command 1","command 2" ]

properties.label: Command Line
properties.description: If multiple commands needs to be run on single command line then select single, if multiple command needs to be run on multiple command line then select multiple

properties.label: Output Type
properties.description: Select Status Code if you want only status code i.e 1, otherwise if one wants the command output then select Command Output

properties.label: Result Variable
properties.description: Name of variable to store the response in. Response should not be more than 32KB

properties.label: Result Expression
properties.description: Expression to map the response into process variables

properties.label: Error Expression
properties.description: Expression to handle errors. Details in the documentation.
